tables.name: dydx_aux_accounting_view
tables.description: This table provides an auxiliary accounting view for DYDX, offering insights into its activity within the Cosmos ecosystem. It displays key metrics such as labels, categories, and amounts of transactions.

columns.name: labels
columns.description: Unique identifier or label associated with each transaction or activity.

columns.name: category
columns.description: Category or type of transaction or activity (e.g., transfer, swap, etc.).

columns.name: amount
columns.description: Amount involved in each transaction or activity, represented in the native cryptocurrency of the Cosmos ecosystem (e.g., ATOM).

tables.name: dydx_balance_module_account
tables.description: This table provides a daily snapshot of balances for accounts in the Cosmos ecosystem, specifically for the balance module account. It showcases the evolution of account balances over time and across different denominations.

columns.name: day
columns.description: The day for which the balance snapshot was taken, represented as a Unix timestamp.

columns.name: address
columns.description: The address of the account for which the balance was recorded.

columns.name: denom
columns.description: The denomination of the token, such as uatom, ubtn, or any other custom token in the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of the token held by the account on the specified day.

tables.name: dydx_block_events
tables.description: This table contains block events from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing a record of all changes and transactions that occur on the blockchain. The data is organized by block height and timestamp for easy analysis and tracking.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain, indicating its position in the chain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block, representing the time at which the block was mined.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: A unique index for each event within a block, allowing for tracking of specific events.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred, categorizing the action or transaction.

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes related to the event, providing more context and information.

columns.name: source
columns.description: The source of the block event, indicating the specific blockchain or node that reported the event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block event was ingested into the database, representing the time of data collection.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to define the structure of the block event data.

tables.name: dydx_blocks
tables.description: This table contains information about blocks in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the network's activity and growth. The data is sourced from various blockchains within the ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain, indicating its position in the chain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created, indicating when the transactions within the block were processed.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the blockchain, distinguishing it from others within the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: The address of the validator that proposed the block, responsible for creating and validating the block's transactions.

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: A hash representing the set of validators that voted on the block, ensuring its integrity and consistency within the network.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the system, reflecting the time it took for the data to be processed and made available.

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: The total size of the messages (transactions) within the block, indicating the volume of data being processed by the network.

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: The number of transactions within the block, reflecting the level of activity and engagement within the network.

tables.name: dydx_cancel_order
tables.description: This table contains a record of all canceled orders on the DYDX exchange, providing insights into the order cancellation activity on the platform. The data is sourced directly from the Cosmos blockchain, ensuring a transparent and tamper-proof record of all transactions.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the order cancellation event was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was mined, indicating the time at which the order cancellation event occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that contained the order cancellation event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block, identifying the specific transaction that contained the order cancellation event.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, identifying the specific message that contained the order cancellation event.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message, identifying the specific action that contained the order cancellation event.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the order cancellation event.

columns.name: subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount associated with the sender, if applicable.

columns.name: order_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the order that was canceled.

columns.name: market_id
columns.description: The identifier of the market in which the order was canceled.

columns.name: type
columns.description: The type of order that was canceled (e.g., limit, market, etc.).

columns.name: expiration_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the order was set to expire, if applicable.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the order cancellation event was ingested into the database.

tables.name: dydx_delegate
tables.description: This table contains information about Cosmos validators' delegation operations, providing insights into the dynamics of the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block on which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block on which the transaction was included.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash identifying the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The position of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The position of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The position of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the transaction.

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The address of the validator involved in the delegation operation.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens delegated or undelegated.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens (e.g., uatom).

columns.name: new_shares
columns.description: The new share amount after the delegation or undelegation.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_deposit
tables.description: This table contains information about deposits made through the DYDX protocol in the Cosmos ecosystem. Each entry represents a single deposit transaction.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the deposit transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the deposit transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that facilitated the deposit.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The sender's address that initiated the deposit transaction.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The recipient's address that received the deposited assets.

columns.name: recipient_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount of the recipient's address that received the deposited assets.

columns.name: quantums
columns.description: The amount of assets deposited in quantum units.

columns.name: asset_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the asset deposited.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_match
tables.description: This table contains information about matches between makers and takers in the DyDX perpetual contracts, offering insights into the dynamics of the perpetual market within the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the match occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the match occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Hash of the transaction that triggered the match.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: Index of the action within the message.

columns.name: taker
columns.description: The account that initiated the taker order.

columns.name: taker_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount associated with the taker.

columns.name: taker_order_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the taker order.

columns.name: maker
columns.description: The account that initiated the maker order.

columns.name: maker_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount associated with the maker.

columns.name: maker_order_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the maker order.

columns.name: taker_order_fee_quote_quantums
columns.description: The fees charged to the taker in quote asset units.

columns.name: maker_order_fee_quote_quantums
columns.description: The fees charged to the maker in quote asset units.

columns.name: maker_quote_balance_delta_quote_quantums
columns.description: The change in the maker's quote asset balance.

columns.name: taker_quote_balance_delta_quote_quantums
columns.description: The change in the taker's quote asset balance.

columns.name: maker_perpetual_quantums_delta_base_quantums
columns.description: The change in the maker's perpetual position in base asset units.

columns.name: taker_perpetual_quantums_delta_base_quantums
columns.description: The change in the taker's perpetual position in base asset units.

columns.name: insurance_fund_delta_quote_quantums
columns.description: The change in the insurance fund balance in quote asset units.

columns.name: is_liquidation
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the match was a result of liquidation.

columns.name: is_deleverage
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the match resulted in deleveraging.

columns.name: perpetual_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the perpetual contract involved in the match.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_mempool_transactions
tables.description: This table provides information on mempool transactions from the Cosmos ecosystem, offering insights into the pending transactions on the network. It helps users analyze the current state of the network's transaction pool.

columns.name: attributes
columns.description: Details about the transaction attributes, such as gas prices, fees, and more.

columns.name: publish_time
columns.description: Timestamp when the transaction was published to the mempool, indicating when it became pending.

columns.name: message_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction message, facilitating tracking and analysis.

columns.name: subscription_name
columns.description: Name of the subscription used to receive the transaction data, providing context for the data source.

columns.name: data
columns.description: Raw transaction data, including the sender, receiver, and transaction details, offering a comprehensive view of the transaction.

tables.name: dydx_message_events
tables.description: This table stores event data from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into system activity over time. It captures key information about transactions, messages, and events across different blocks.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the event was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the event was created.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that triggered the event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the message.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred, categorizing the event into different types.

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes associated with the event, providing more context.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the event data was ingested into the system.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store the event data.

tables.name: dydx_message_senders
tables.description: This table tracks the senders of messages in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the transactions and interactions within the network. The data is sourced from blockchain transactions and covers various events.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included, representing the sequence of transactions within the blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was created, indicating the time of the transaction occurrence.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction, allowing for the tracking of specific transactions across the blockchain.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block, enabling the identification of transactions within a specific block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, allowing for the isolation of specific messages within a transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message, enabling the tracking of specific actions within a message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the entity that initiated the transaction, representing the origin of the message.

columns.name: action
columns.description: A description of the action taken by the sender, providing context for the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system, indicating the time of data availability.

tables.name: dydx_message_types_transactions
tables.description: This table contains transaction messages from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the blockchain activity. It includes metadata such as block height, timestamp, and sender information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the entity that initiated the transaction.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of message sent in the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_place_order
tables.description: This table contains records of DYDX Place Orders events, providing insights into the market activity and user interactions within the Cosmos ecosystem. It offers a detailed view of the order placement process, including the sender, order details, and market information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was mined, indicating the sequence of events in the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction was mined, representing the time when the order was placed.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique hash representing the transaction that contains the order placement event, facilitating the tracing of the order's origin.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block, allowing for the identification of the specific transaction containing the order placement event.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, enabling the isolation of the order placement message.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message, allowing for the identification of the specific action taken during the order placement process.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the user who initiated the order placement, representing the party responsible for the transaction.

columns.name: subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount associated with the sender's address, allowing for the differentiation of multiple accounts under a single address.

columns.name: order_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the placed order, facilitating the tracking of the order's status and execution.

columns.name: quantums
columns.description: The quantity of the asset being ordered, representing the amount of the asset being traded.

columns.name: subticks
columns.description: The sub-tick price of the asset, providing a more granular representation of the asset's price.

columns.name: market_id
columns.description: The identifier of the market in which the order was placed, indicating the specific asset pair being traded.

columns.name: direction
columns.description: The direction of the order, specifying whether the order is a buy or sell operation.

columns.name: type
columns.description: The type of order, such as limit or market order, indicating the conditions under which the order will be executed.

columns.name: trigger_condition
columns.description: The trigger condition for the order, specifying the conditions under which the order will be activated.

columns.name: trigger_subticks
columns.description: The sub-tick price at which the trigger condition will be evaluated.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo associated with the order, providing additional context or information about the order.

columns.name: reduce_only
columns.description: A flag indicating whether the order can be reduced, allowing for the partial execution of the order.

columns.name: expiration_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the order will expire, specifying the deadline for the order's execution.

columns.name: on_expiration
columns.description: The action to take when the order expires, such as cancel or expire, indicating the desired outcome.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database, representing the time when the order placement event was recorded.

tables.name: dydx_settled_funding
tables.description: This table contains information about settled funding events from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the financial transactions and balances of perpetual contracts. It helps in understanding the overall dynamics of the decentralized financial system.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction associated with the funding event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount associated with the funding event.

columns.name: subaccount_number
columns.description: The number of the subaccount associated with the funding event.

columns.name: funding_paid_quote_quantums
columns.description: The quantums of quote asset paid or received during the funding event.

columns.name: perpetual_id
columns.description: The ID of the perpetual contract associated with the funding event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_state
tables.description: The dydx_state table contains information about the state of decentralized finance (DeFi) lending and borrowing on the Cosmos-based DyDX protocol. It provides a snapshot of the current lending and borrowing positions on the blockchain.

columns.name: type
columns.description: The type of state on the DyDX protocol (e.g. lending, borrowing, etc.).

columns.name: block
columns.description: The block number on the Cosmos blockchain where the state was recorded.

columns.name: block_time
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created, indicating when the state was recorded.

columns.name: deleted
columns.description: A flag indicating whether the state has been deleted or not.

columns.name: val
columns.description: The value of the state (e.g. the amount of a specific asset borrowed or lent).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the state was ingested into the datasource.

tables.name: dydx_transactions
tables.description: This table contains a collection of transactions from the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into the blockchain activity, including transaction details and fees.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: Details about the transaction, including the sender and receiver.

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: A log message generated during the transaction process.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A note or comment left with the transaction.

columns.name: fee
columns.description: The fee associated with the transaction.

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: The code executed during the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas used during the transaction.

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: The amount of gas requested for the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to process the transaction.

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: The coins used to pay the transaction fee.

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: The account that granted the fee.

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: The account that paid the transaction fee.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas allowed for the transaction.

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: Whether the transaction was executed in single- sign mode.

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: The JSON data associated with multi-sign transactions.

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: The height at which the transaction will be timed out if not executed.

tables.name: dydx_transfer
tables.description: This table captures transfer events on the Cosmos ecosystem, representing the movement of assets between users. It provides a detailed record of transactional activities, including sender and recipient information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transfer occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transfer occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that initiated the transfer.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the user who initiated the transfer.

columns.name: sender_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount of the sender, if applicable.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The address of the user who received the transfer.

columns.name: recipient_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount of the recipient, if applicable.

columns.name: quantums
columns.description: The amount of assets transferred in quantum units.

columns.name: asset_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the asset being transferred.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_tx_messages
tables.description: This table contains transaction messages from the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides a detailed record of all messages sent across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain where the transaction message was recorded.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain where the transaction message was recorded.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that contains the recorded message.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block where the message was recorded.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of message recorded in the transaction.

columns.name: message
columns.description: The actual message recorded in the transaction.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to record the transaction message.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction message was ingested into the data source.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block where the transaction message was recorded.

tables.name: dydx_undelegate
tables.description: This table contains information about undelegation events for validators in the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides details about the validators who have delegated tokens to others.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block at which the undelegation event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block at which the undelegation event occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that triggered the undelegation event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction that triggered the undelegation event within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message that triggered the undelegation event within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action that triggered the undelegation event within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that initiated the undelegation event.

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The validator who was previously delegated tokens.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens that were undelegated.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens that were undelegated.

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: The time at which the undelegation event was finalized.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: dydx_validators
tables.description: Table describing active validators on the Cosmos network, containing their operator and account information.

columns.name: operator_address
columns.description: Address of the validator's operator account.

columns.name: account_address
columns.description: Address of the validator's account.

columns.name: consensus_pubkey
columns.description: Validator's consensus public key.

columns.name: jailed
columns.description: Boolean indicating whether the validator is currently jailed.

columns.name: status
columns.description: Validator status.

columns.name: tokens
columns.description: Validator's staked tokens.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: Validator's moniker.

columns.name: identity
columns.description: Validator's identity.

columns.name: website
columns.description: Validator's website.

columns.name: security_contact
columns.description: Validator's security contact.

columns.name: details
columns.description: Additional details about the validator.

columns.name: unbonding_height
columns.description: Height at which the validator's unbonding period will end.

columns.name: unbonding_time
columns.description: Timestamp at which the validator's unbonding period will end.

columns.name: commission_rate
columns.description: Validator's commission rate.

columns.name: commission_max_rate
columns.description: Validator's maximum commission rate.

columns.name: commission_max_change_rate
columns.description: Validator's maximum commission rate change.

columns.name: commission_update_time
columns.description: Timestamp at which the validator's commission was last updated.

columns.name: min_self_delegation
columns.description: Minimum self-delegation amount for the validator.

columns.name: snapshot_height
columns.description: Snapshot height for the validator.

columns.name: snapshot_time
columns.description: Timestamp of the snapshot for the validator.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested.

tables.name: dydx_vote
tables.description: This table contains information about governance votes on the Cosmos network, providing insights into the decision-making process of the community. The data is sourced from blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the vote transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the vote transaction was created.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that submitted the vote.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that submitted the vote.

columns.name: proposal_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the proposal being voted on.

columns.name: option
columns.description: The chosen option by the sender for the proposal.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: dydx_withdrawal
tables.description: This table provides data on DYDX withdrawals, offering insights into transaction activity within the Cosmos ecosystem. The data is sourced from blockchain events.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the blockchain block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the blockchain block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within a block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within a transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within a message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the transaction.

columns.name: sender_subaccount
columns.description: The subaccount of the sender (if applicable).

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The address of the account that received the funds.

columns.name: quantums
columns.description: The amount of quantums transferred.

columns.name: asset_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the asset being transferred.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.
